    • The Problem

    The Solution

    At the time, there were no methods developed to send out mass notifications to individuals with crtical information.

    My objective was to create a fast and reliable method for institutions to reach hundreds of people with critical messages within seconds.

    For example, schools had no way of notifying every parent of an emergency school shutdown, without calling each one individually.

    The challenge was a combination of integrating the phone and VoIP technologies, with on-the-fly launching of message campaigns, and finishing with live results.

    Design, Planning & Research

    After defining the problem and identifying the solution, the next step involved design planning and research. In this phase, I developed my requirements and mapped out the process flow.


    Requirements
    Flow Charts

    High Fidelity Mockups

    Because there were a lot of pieces to put together to create a campaign, it was important to keep the construction of the message easy so users wouldn't get lost or forget a step.
